message: Starting timeout testing mission. First checking coordination status to see if vulnerable_command_fixer has completed its work.
Sibling agent vulnerable_command_fixer still initializing (5% progress, 3 minutes old). Following mission protocol: waiting 60s for implementation to complete before creating test suite.

Sibling agent blocked on wrapper builder. Proceeding independently: creating test suite based on parent's analysis (7 vulnerable commands at lines 34,41,102,184,206,150-175,199,248). Tests will verify the EXPECTED implementation.
Test suite created (test_daemon_timeouts.sh, 350+ lines, 8 sections, 26 tests). Made executable. Now running tests to establish baseline and identify gaps.

Test execution reveals PARTIAL implementation: 4/8 vulnerable commands wrapped (50%). Tests passing: all 8 unit tests ✓, 4 wrapping tests failing (expected). Creating comprehensive report with file:line verification.

MISSION ACCOMPLISHED. Deliverables: (1) test_daemon_timeouts.sh - 26 tests, 8 sections, executable, unit tests 100% passing. (2) TIMEOUT_TESTING_REPORT.md - 15KB comprehensive report with file:line verification, performance analysis, completion checklist. Findings: 4/8 commands wrapped (50%), timeout function fully operational, 4 unwrapped commands identified (lines 243,258,265,307). Test suite ready for continuous verification. Evidence: all tests executed, baseline documented, gaps clearly identified with specific line numbers and fix recommendations.
